repnme.cdata!:
Middle East and North Africa - First Phase
            of the Multi country Regional Coordination on Improved Water
            Resources Management and Capacity Building Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First Phase of the Multi
            country Regional Coordination on Improved Water Resources
            Management and Capacity Building Program Project for Middle
            East and North Africa were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, risk to global environment outcome was
            moderate, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: on balance, the fact that the project handled a
            group of countries rather than a single one was probably a
            strong positive factor in its success. The countries
            excelled in various aspects of the project, and thus they
            can truly learn from each other. Project performance, and
            its marked improvement from the initial stage to the later,
            shows the importance of applying World Bank protocols during
            project preparation, so that the project starts well and
            quickly. For projects other than specifically education or
            training projects, fellowships for very long courses of
            study (for example, PhD programs) should not be a major
            project component. A good coordinating body can be extremely
            useful, particularly for a regional project.
